headline: Affirm (NASDAQ:AFRM) Beats Expectations in Strong Q2, Stock Soars
summary: Buy now, pay later company Affirm (NASDAQ:AFRM) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 33% year on year to $876.4 million. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was better than expected at $870 million at the midpoint, 1.2% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $0.20 per share was 75.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was better than expected at $870 million at the midpoint, 1.2% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $0.20 per share was 75.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: 5 Financial Transaction Stocks in Focus Amid Strong Cross-Border Volumes
summary: The Financial Transaction Services industry is gaining on the widespread adoption of digital means, strong consumer spending and pursuit of M&A activities. Companies like V, MA, FI, PYPL and WEX are well-positioned to thrive on the back of these favorable trends.

headline: Ammunition Payment Gateways Alternative: Blue Payment Agency CEO on Why He Follows Up on Every Emergency Call Personally
summary: Blue Payment Agency is positioning itself as an alternative for ammunition payment gateways, and its CEO says his personal follow-up on every emergency call is central to that approach. As mainstream processors like Stripe, Square, and PayPal continue to close or decline many firearms-related accounts, the company is rolling out specialized, stable, and affordable merchant accounts tailored for online ammunition retailers.

headline: Does PayPal’s Recent German Banking Crisis Signal a Hidden Opportunity for Investors?
summary: If you are standing at a crossroads with PayPal Holdings, you are not alone. For every investor, the real question is what should you do next with the stock after a whirlwind of ups and downs? The past week saw a modest lift, up 3.1%, but that comes on the heels of a rocky year. Year-to-date, PayPal’s stock is still down 19.2%, and it has lost 66% of its value over the past five years. At first glance, these numbers might give you pause, but they also hint at the kind of volatility that can...
